title: Geometric sans, similar to VAG Rounded
content:
Hi everybody,

Can you help me to identify these four letter, I was thinking it was arial rounded, but its not that.

Thanks

Marc

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [LOGO2004.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131218002052/http:/typophile.com/files/LOGO2004.gif) | 2.91 KB |
author: Marc C

comments.content: [Cennerik](http://web.archive.org/web/20131218002052/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/cennerik/bold/) by Robert Schenk is close. AG Book Rounded has a spur at its ‘G’ and therefore it’s out.

Oops, I changed the thread name without posting that it looks a bit like [VAG Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20131218002052/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=vag+rounded&x=0&y=0&sample_text=A%20G%20M%20Q&sample_size=36). Other possibilities are [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20131218002052/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=bryant&x=0&y=0&sample_text=A%20G%20M%20Q&sample_size=36) and [Gotham Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20131218002052/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gothamrounded/index.html).

VAG Rounded has sloping verticals with its M. Bryant’s right-hand side of the G has a flat section. Gotham’s G too, and its M’s middle vertex additionally ends above the baseline.  
Though I don’t think Cennerik in fact has anything to do with the creation of the posted sample, I still would say it’s closer than the others.  
:°)

Alternative: DaltonMaag’s new Tondo.

[http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/tondo/standard](http://web.archive.org/web/20131218002052/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/tondo/standard "http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/tondo/standard")

\_\_\_  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
I wasn't implying anything, just offering a couple of alternatives. ;^)
